results.title: The Great War
results.creator_credit: Alan Anderson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “War Experience”.
Uses contemporary film records of the Australian forces in the 1914-18 War to illustrate the conditions in which they served and the effects on survivors.

results.title: Golf in Australia
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Illustrates the wide popularity of golf in Australia, showing the variety of courses and outlining training schemes and other aspects of the sport. Concludes with scenes from professional tournaments.

results.title: Goldtown
results.creator_credit: R. Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The story of Australia’s fabulous town with the “golden mile” - Kalgoorlie in Western Australia, a goldmining town in the midst of a forbidding desert where the water supply is piped hundreds of miles overland.
results.creator_credit_for_label: R. Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Gift of life
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: An account of the collections of blood from donors and its use in hospitals. Stresses the need for blood for transfusions every hour as part of medical service today; the procedure of voluntary donation, facilities provided and the careful labelling, testing and typing carried out by the Red Cross staff; the method of refrigerated storage and transport; use of separated components; an operation in process with the assistance of blood transfusions.

results.title: Ghan to Alice
results.creator_credit: Curtis Levy, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Follows two rodeo riders travelling from Moree to the Alice Springs Rodeo on the Ghan train. Includes shots of the country through which the Ghan passes and briefly looks at towns along the route. Commentary by Bill Willougby.

results.title: Geraldton
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Geraldton, Western Australia, is a fast developing town as it is the major supply centre and port of the north of the state. A glimpse of the people, industries, such as building and crayfishing, and social life of Geraldton.

results.title: Fuel for thought
results.brief_description: Explains how to take fire precautions for houses in bush settings. Also gives details on how to prevent fire from spreading, how to fight a fire and what to do to avoid injury from a fire.
results.description: Explains how to take fire precautions for houses in bush settings. Also gives details on how to prevent fire from spreading, how to fight a fire and what to do to avoid injury from a fire.

results.title: From the tropics to the snow
results.creator_credit: J Lee, R. Mason, Malcolm Otton, Stanley Hawes and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A tourist film of Australia. It is not a travelogue but a story combining humour with selling and entertainment with information; highlighting the difficulties of a producer, director and script-writer in the making of a short film which is to show all the tourist attractions of Australia. The film gently (and not so gently) laughs at all those aspects of the Australian way of life that are usually included in films about Australia, and also shows some of the not so well known attractions of the country. (Awards: Gold Award, Travel Category; Australian National Travel Association’s “Jedda Award”; Kodak Silver Award for colour photography, Australian Film Awards, 1965).

results.title: Freeway driving
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Emphasises the particular skills needed for safe use of freeways where road speed is greater than normal and driving dkills are different.
